meanings.definition: Of or relating to an epiphany.
meanings.sent1: The epiphanous moment in the story made the character understand everything clearly.
meanings.sent2: Her epiphanous expression showed that she finally grasped the concept.
meanings.sent3: The epiphanous realization that he had been using the wrong key all along made him laugh.
meanings.sent4: The epiphanous light bulb above his head symbolized his sudden understanding.
meanings.sent5: The epiphanous sunset painted the sky with colors he had never seen before.

meanings.definition: Revealing or showing a sudden realization or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The epiphanous truth hit her like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent2: His epiphanous expression gave away his newfound knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The epiphanous moment when she realized she had been talking to the wrong person was embarrassing.
meanings.sent4: The epiphanous spotlight on the stage highlighted her sudden insight.
meanings.sent5: The epiphanous mirror reflected the truth she had been avoiding.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a moment of profound insight or revelation.
meanings.sent1: The epiphanous dream left him with a deep understanding of himself.
meanings.sent2: Their epiphanous conversation changed the course of their relationship.
meanings.sent3: The epiphanous discovery of a hidden room in the house was exciting.
meanings.sent4: The epiphanous thunderstorm outside mirrored his internal realization.
meanings.sent5: The epiphanous mountain peak revealed a breathtaking view of the valley below.
